mn123:0.1_0: For the middle part of the night,
mn123:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
mn123:10.1_0: Sir, I have heard and learned this in the presence of the Buddha:
mn123:10.2_0: ‘When the being intent on awakening is conceived in his mother’s belly, she no longer feels sexual desire for men, and she cannot be violated by a man of lustful intent.’
mn123:10.3_0: This too I remember as an incredible quality of the Buddha.
mn123:11.1_0: Sir, I have heard and learned this in the presence of the Buddha:
mn123:11.2_0: ‘When the being intent on awakening is conceived in his mother’s belly, she becomes pregnant.
mn123:11.2_1: There she amuses herself, supplied and provided with the five kinds of sensual stimulation.’
mn123:11.3_0: This too I remember as an incredible quality of the Buddha.
mn123:12.1_0: Sir, I have heard and learned this in the presence of the Buddha:
mn123:12.2_0: ‘When the being intent on awakening is conceived in his mother’s belly, no afflictions beset her.
mn123:12.2_1: She’s happy and free of bodily fatigue.
mn123:12.2_2: She’s born into awakening in her womb, complete with all his various parts, not deficient in any faculty.
mn123:12.3_0: Suppose there was a beryl gem that was naturally beautiful, eight-faceted, well-worked.
mn123:12.3_1: And it was strung with a thread of blue, yellow, red, white, or golden brown.
mn123:12.4_0: And someone with good eyesight were to take it in their hand and examine it: “This beryl gem is naturally beautiful, eight-faceted, well-worked. And it’s strung with a thread of blue, yellow, red, white, or golden brown.”
mn123:12.5_0: In the same way, when the being intent on awakening is conceived in his mother’s belly, no afflictions beset her.
mn123:12.5_1: She’s happy and free of bodily fatigue.
mn123:12.5_2: And they see the being intent on awakening in her womb, complete with all his various parts, not deficient in any faculty.’
mn123:12.6_0: This too I remember as an incredible quality of the Buddha.
mn123:13.1_0: Sir, I have heard and learned this in the presence of the Buddha:
mn123:13.2_0: ‘Seven days after the being intent on awakening is born, his mother passes away and is reborn in the host of Joyful Gods.’
mn123:13.3_0: This too I remember as an incredible quality of the Buddha.
mn123:14.1_0: Sir, I have heard and learned this in the presence of the Buddha:
mn123:14.2_0: ‘Other women carry the infant in the womb for nine or ten months before giving birth.
mn123:14.2_1: Not so the mother of the being intent on awakening. She gives birth after exactly ten months.’
mn123:14.3_0: This too I remember as an incredible quality of the Buddha.
mn123:15.1_0: Sir, I have heard and learned this in the presence of the Buddha:
mn123:15.2_0: ‘Other women give birth while sitting or lying down.
mn123:15.2_1: Not so the mother of the being intent on awakening. She only gives birth standing up.’
mn123:15.3_0: This too I remember as an incredible quality of the Buddha.
mn123:16.1_0: Sir, I have heard and learned this in the presence of the Buddha:
mn123:16.2_0: ‘When the being intent on awakening emerges from his mother’s womb, gods receive him first, then humans.’
mn123:16.3_0: This too I remember as an incredible quality of the Buddha.
mn123:17.1_0: Sir, I have heard and learned this in the presence of the Buddha:
mn123:17.2_0: ‘When the being intent on awakening emerges from his mother’s womb, before he reaches the ground, four deities receive him and place him before his mother, saying:
mn123:17.3_0: This too I remember as an incredible quality of the Buddha.
mn123:18.1_0: Sir, I have heard and learned this in the presence of the Buddha:
mn123:18.2_0: ‘When the being intent on awakening emerges from his mother’s womb, he emerges already clean, unsoiled by waters, mucus, blood, or any other kind of impurity, pure and clean.
mn123:18.3_0: Suppose a jewel-treasure was placed on a cloth from Kāsī. The jewel would not soil the cloth, nor would the cloth soil the jewel.
mn123:18.6_0: In the same way, when the being intent on awakening emerges from his mother’s womb, he emerges already clean, unsoiled by waters, mucus, blood, or any other kind of impurity, pure and clean.’
mn123:18.7_0: This too I remember as an incredible quality of the Buddha.
mn123:19.1_0: Sir, I have heard and learned this in the presence of the Buddha:
mn123:19.2_0: ‘When the being intent on awakening emerges from his mother’s womb, two streams of water appear in the sky, one cool, one warm, for bathing the being intent on awakening and his mother.
mn123:19.2_1: by doing his mother, father, and his nails.’
mn123:19.3_0: This too I remember as an incredible quality of the Buddha.
mn123:2.10_0: and told the mendicants what had happened.
mn123:2.11_0: “Mendicants, what were you sitting talking about just now? What conversation was unfinished?”
mn123:2.12_0: So the mendicants told him what they had been talking about. The Buddha said:
mn123:2.13_0: ‘It’s incredible, reverends, it’s amazing, the Realized One has become completely extinguished, cut off proliferation, cut off the track, finished off the cycle, and transcended suffering. It’s impossible the Realized One could know all of the world
mn123:2.14_0: He knows the caste they were born in, and also their names,
mn123:2.14_6: That is how they were freed from the Buddhas.’
mn123:2.14_7: When he had spoken, Ānanda said to us,
mn123:2.15_0: ‘The Realized Ones are incredible, reverends, and they have incredible qualities.
mn123:2.16_0: They’re amazing, and they have amazing qualities.’
mn123:2.17_0: This is the conversation that was unfinished when the Buddha arrived.”
mn123:2.19_0: “Well then, Ānanda, say some more about the incredible and amazing qualities of the Realized One.”
mn123:2.1_0: Then after the meal, on return from alms-round, several senior mendicants sat together in the assembly hall and this discussion came up among them:
mn123:2.2_0: “It’s incredible, reverends, it’s amazing, the power and might of a Realized One!
mn123:2.3_0: For he is able to know the Buddhas of the past who have become completely extinguished, cut off proliferation, cut off the track, finished off the cycle, and transcended suffering.
mn123:2.4_0: He knows the caste they were born in, and also their names, clans, conduct, teaching, wisdom, meditation, and freedom.”
mn123:2.5_0: When they said this, Venerable Ānanda said,
mn123:2.6_0: “The Realized Ones are incredible, reverends, and they have incredible qualities.
mn123:2.7_0: They’re amazing, and they have amazing qualities.”
mn123:2.9_0: Then in the late afternoon, the Buddha came out of retreat, went to the assembly hall, where he sat on the seat spread out,
mn123:2.9_1: where he sat down on a prepared seat.
mn123:20.1_0: Sir, I have heard and learned this in the presence of the Buddha:
mn123:20.2_0: ‘I am born, marking out with the being intent on awakening. I get his feet back from the north to the south, woke upwards and pulling back, greeting one with joined palms, and be reborn in the world.’
mn123:20.2_1: ‘This is my last rebirth. Now there are no more future lives.’
mn123:20.3_0: This too I remember as an incredible quality of the Buddha.
mn123:21.1_0: Sir, I have heard and learned this in the presence of the Buddha:
mn123:21.2_0: ‘When the being intent on awakening emerges from his mother’s womb, then—in this world with its gods, Māras and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, gods and humans—an immeasurable, magnificent light appears, surpassing the glory of the gods.
mn123:21.3_0: Even in the boundless desolation of interstellar space—so utterly dark that even the light of the moon and the sun, so mighty and powerful, makes no impression—an immeasurable, magnificent light appears, surpassing the glory of the gods.
mn123:21.4_0: And the sentient beings reborn there recognize each other by that light: “So, it seems other sentient beings have been reborn here!”
mn123:21.5_0: And this galaxy shakes and rocks and trembles. And an immeasurable, magnificent light appears in the world, surpassing the glory of the gods.’
mn123:21.6_0: This too I remember as an incredible and amazing quality of the Buddha.”
mn123:22.1_0: “Well then, Ānanda, you should also remember this as an incredible and amazing quality of the Realized One.
mn123:22.2_0: It’s that the Realized One knows feelings as they arise, as they remain, and as they go away.
mn123:22.3_0: He knows perceptions as they arise, as they remain, and as they go away.
mn123:22.4_0: They know thoughts as they arise, as they remain, and as they go away.
mn123:22.5_0: This too you should remember as an incredible and amazing quality of the Realized One.”
mn123:23.1_0: “Sir, the Buddha knows feelings as they arise, as they remain, and as they go away.
mn123:23.2_0: He knows perceptions as they arise, as they remain, and as they go away.
mn123:23.3_0: They know thoughts as they arise, as they remain, and as they go away.
mn123:23.4_0: This too I remember as an incredible and amazing quality of the Buddha.”
mn123:23.5_0: This is what Venerable Ānanda said,
mn123:23.7_0: Satisfied, those mendicants were happy with what Venerable Ānanda said.
mn123:23.8_0: The third section on the incredible and amazing qualities is finished.
mn123:3.1_0: “Sir, I have heard and learned this in the presence of the Buddha:
mn123:3.2_0: ‘Mindful and aware, the being intent on awakening was reborn in the host of Joyful Gods.’
mn123:3.3_0: This I remember as an incredible quality of the Buddha.
mn123:4.1_0: Sir, I have heard and learned this in the presence of the Buddha:
mn123:4.2_0: ‘Mindful and aware, the being intent on awakening remained in the host of Joyful Gods.’
mn123:4.3_0: This too I remember as an incredible quality of the Buddha.
mn123:5.1_0: Sir, I have heard and learned this in the presence of the Buddha:
mn123:5.2_0: ‘For the whole of that life, the being intent on awakening remained in the host of Joyful Gods.’
mn123:5.3_0: This too I remember as an incredible quality of the Buddha.
mn123:6.1_0: Sir, I have heard and learned this in the presence of the Buddha:
mn123:6.2_0: ‘Mindful and aware, the being intent on awakening passed away from the host of Joyful Gods and was conceived in his mother’s womb.’
mn123:6.3_0: This too I remember as an incredible quality of the Buddha.
mn123:7.1_0: Sir, I have heard and learned this in the presence of the Buddha:
mn123:7.2_0: ‘When the being intent on awakening passes away from the host of Joyful Gods, he is conceived in his mother’s womb.
mn123:7.3_0: And then—in this world with its gods, Māras and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, gods and humans—an immeasurable, magnificent light appears, surpassing the glory of the gods.
mn123:7.4_0: Even in the boundless desolation of interstellar space—so utterly dark that even the light of the moon and the sun, so mighty and powerful, makes no impression—an immeasurable, magnificent light appears, surpassing the glory of the gods.
mn123:7.5_0: And the sentient beings reborn there recognize each other by that light: “So, it seems other sentient beings have been reborn here!”
mn123:7.6_0: And this galaxy shakes and rocks and trembles. And an immeasurable, magnificent light appears in the world, surpassing the glory of the gods.’
mn123:7.7_0: This too I remember as an incredible quality of the Buddha.
mn123:8.1_0: Sir, I have heard and learned this in the presence of the Buddha:
mn123:8.2_0: ‘When the being intent on awakening is conceived in his mother’s belly, four deities approach to guard the four directions, so that no human or non-human or anyone at all shall harm the being intent on awakening or his mother.’
mn123:8.3_0: This too I remember as an incredible quality of the Buddha.
mn123:9.1_0: Sir, I have heard and learned this in the presence of the Buddha:
mn123:9.2_0: ‘When the being intent on awakening is conceived in his mother’s belly, she becomes naturally ethical. She refrains from killing living creatures, stealing, sexual misconduct, lying, and alcoholic drinks that cause negligence.’
mn123:9.3_0: This too I remember as an incredible quality of the Buddha.
